meanings.definition: A basic drum rudiment consisting of four alternating strokes, typically played as RLRR or LRLL.
meanings.sent1: During the drum lesson, the instructor demonstrated how to play a paradiddle.
meanings.sent2: The drummer practiced the paradiddle to improve their drumming skills.
meanings.sent3: The little drummer boy's favorite move was the paradiddle; it always made him smile.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers danced on the drumsticks, creating a paradiddle rhythm that mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The paradiddle, with its rhythmic pattern, became the heartbeat of the music.

meanings.definition: To play a paradiddle on a drum or percussion instrument.
meanings.sent1: He will paradiddle on the drums during the performance.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys paradiddling on her drum set in the garage.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to paradiddle on the pots and pans, creating a unique melody.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops paradiddled on the roof, creating a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent5: As the wind picked up, the leaves paradiddled against the window, creating a calming sound.
